result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Certified copy of Judgment of Conviction in Case 21CF16 filed by ADA Ryan at 7/22/2022 Preliminary Hearing

Case called @ 11:41 AM Defendant Michael C. Kasch in court.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Michael C. Kasch. Deputy Zach Gunderson sworn in for testimony. Direct examination by ADA Ryan. Witness identifies the defendant in the courtroom. Cross examination by Atty Rae. Witness excused at 11:49AM. The Court finds probable cause does exist. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. NG plea entered as to all counts. STC scheduled - NOH given.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:20 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 09:20 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any drug paraphernalia. Defendant is prohibited from being in possession of any alcohol.
